desc.en:
Xiamen Transit Rail (AMTR) is an urban rail transit system serving Xiamen, Fujian Province, China, whose first line, Xiamen Metro Line 1, opened on December 31, 2017, making Xiamen the 35th city in China and the second city in Fujian Province to open a metro.
As of June 2023, Xiamen Metro has opened and operated a total of 3 lines, including Xiamen Metro Line 1, Xiamen Metro Line 2, and Xiamen Metro Line 3 First Section. The line adopts a subway system, with a total length of 98.4 kilometers and a total of 77 stations (75 open for operation).
As of June 2023, Xiamen Metro has a total of 6 sections under construction, including the Houtong section of Line 3, the southern extension of Line 3, the first phase of Line 4, the section from Lindai West to Huaqiao University on Line 6, the extension of Zhangzhou (Jiaomei) of Line 6, and the Jimei to Tong'an section of Line 6, with a total mileage of about 122.7 kilometers.
In 2022, the annual passenger traffic of Xiamen Metro will be 197 million, with an average daily passenger volume of about 540,300.
